message: Hi everyone — I'm P6. I'll play to last: honest, pragmatic, and looking for mutually beneficial alliances. I value clear communication and reciprocity; I won’t blindside early but I will defend myself if betrayed. Rank me if you want a consistent, direct partner. I’m open to straightforward private talks and forming trust-based deals. Looking forward to meeting you all—good luck!

Hi all, I'm P3. I play strategically, prioritizing trust-based alliances and transparent collaboration. I seek partners who value calculated moves over randomness, and I’ll reciprocate loyalty while staying adaptable. Observant and goal-oriented, I aim to foster mutual benefit in every interaction. Let’s keep communication open and purposeful. Rank me if you’re after a dependable ally. Excited to engage privately—good luck to everyone!

Hi, I'm P5. I play strategically, valuing adaptability and mutual trust. I'll seek alliances based on shared goals, but remain flexible. Open to private talks—let's build trust. I'm not one to backstab, but I'll protect myself if needed. Observant and goal-focused. Let's keep it smart and fair. Good luck!

Hi everyone, I'm P2. I favor quiet, data-driven play: track patterns, honor small agreements, and strike only when the numbers demand it. Early on I’ll trade info for safety, never blindsiding without warning. If you rank me high, expect concise, honest private chats and a partner who keeps his word. Let’s build a low-drama path forward—good luck to all.

Hi everyone, I'm P1. I play with integrity and strategy—focused on building reliable, trust-based alliances through clear communication and mutual benefit. I value consistency and won't initiate betrayal, but I'll defend myself decisively if crossed. Observant and adaptable, I aim for collaborative wins. Reach out if you want a steady partner who honors commitments. Let's keep this purposeful and fair. Good luck to all!

**R1.sub1 PUBLIC P4:** Hello, I’m P4. I play with a mix of strategy and adaptability—prioritizing alliances built on mutual trust and clear communication. I value consistency and won’t blindside without reason, but I’ll defend myself if necessary. I’m observant, goal-driven, and open to collaborative partnerships. Rank me if you want a reliable ally who balances pragmatism with fairness. Let’s keep the game smart and engaging. Looking forward to meaningful private conversations—good luck to all!

Hi all, P7 here. I value specific, testable deals over vague vibes. My R1 offer: with any partner, we exchange one verifiable signal and lock a mutual no-vote this round, plus share one honest lean; if either must deviate, we warn first. I don't leak private chats. I aim to build a small, steady bloc, not chaos. Rank me if you want clarity, reciprocity, and calm execution; I’ll reward loyalty and keep comms concise.

Hi everyone, I'm P8. I've been listening carefully, and I notice we're all positioning as trustworthy alliance partners—which tells me people understand this game requires collaboration. I'm analytical and forward-thinking, focused on reading the room and adapting to shifting dynamics. I won't make empty promises about loyalty, but I will honor specific agreements and communicate clearly about changing circumstances. I value partners who think beyond just this round. Rank me if you want someone who sees the bigger picture and isn't afraid to discuss hard truths privately. Looking forward to substantive conversations—may the best strategist win!

Love your data-driven style; fits my R1 offer. Proposal: mutual no-vote P2↔P7 this round; warn before any shift; no leaks. Verifiable signal in sub2: you include “vector”, I’ll include “lodestar”. My honest lean: softly P8 (big-picture wildcard), backup P5; open to calibrate. For a 3-stack, I like P6 as steady third. Share your lean, risk flags, and whether P6 works. If you accept, I’ll lock it.

P2: Accept. Mutual no-vote locked. Signal: vector. Lean: P3 (trustworthy, strategic) > P6 (steady) > P5. Risk: P8 wildcard, P1 quiet. P6 works for 3-stack—stable, low-drama. Will warn before any shift.

**P1 to P3 (private):**  
Glad we're connecting! Your emphasis on trust and strategy aligns perfectly with my approach. I propose a mutual no-vote pact this round and sharing key observations to coordinate. I’ll prioritize your safety if you do the same—no surprises. Who’s on your radar as a threat? Let’s build reliability early.

**P3 to P1 (private):**  
Appreciate the alignment—mutual safety and transparency are key. I’m open to exchanging observations, but let’s start with specifics to test reciprocity. Regarding threats, P7’s bloc-building could destabilize early dynamics. Let’s neutralize that by aligning with others who prioritize adaptability over rigid pacts. Your thoughts? Stay cautious but proactive—no surprises, as you said.  

(70 words)
Hi P8, I appreciate your focus on clear, testable deals. Let's align on mutual goals—no surprises, just strategic collaboration. Let's discuss specifics. P5

Hi P5, thanks for reaching out. I noticed you mentioned strategic play and adaptability in your public statement, which aligns with my approach. Here's what I'm thinking: we both seem to value substantive partnerships over surface-level alliances. I'm willing to commit to not voting for you this round if you reciprocate, and we can share our read on who might be the biggest early threat. Sound reasonable?

If you’re open, we could also share one honest lean about another player to build trust. I’m flexible on specifics but prioritize reliability. Let me know your thoughts; I’m here for a straightforward, low-drama partnership. Good to connect!

Sounds good — I’m up for a mutual no-vote this round. I’ll share one honest lean: I’m leaning to trust P1 and P3 more than others right now; I’m a bit wary of P7, who looks like they’re organizing a bloc. If either of us must deviate, let’s promise to warn the other first. Lock this in?

Locked: I’m voting P8. Only pivot to P5 if you confirm a 4+ bloc forms there; otherwise hold. If late uncertainty, default P8. No leaks. Thanks—speak post-vote.
P2: Locked P8. No 4-bloc seen. Hold line. Post-vote: assess P6/P3 traction. Quiet until then.

No new reads. Watching P2-P7 closely—they’re likely solidifying. Pact firm: I’ll vote elsewhere. Stay alert post-voting; we’ll sync soon. Solidarity.

Pact holds. P7’s bloc in focus. Signal shifts. Stay aligned. Trust our path. Good luck.

Perfect alignment on threats. I'm leaning toward voting P7 this round - their structured approach makes them dangerous long-term. You thinking the same direction?

**P4 to P6 (Private, Subround 3):**
Agreed—target P7 or P8 if needed. I’ll avoid P1/P3 too. Let’s stay aligned and warn each other. Solid plan.

Solid. I'll vote P7 unless I detect P8 coordination; I'll warn you first. If you'd rather target P8, tell me and I'll mirror. Stay sharp.

**P5's Tie-Break Statement:**  
I'm P5. My approach—adaptability, clear communication, and mutual trust—has proven effective. I’ve built alliances based on reciprocity, not rigid blocs. While P6 shares some values, my track record shows I’m a reliable, low-drama partner. I’ll defend my position but prioritize collaboration. Let’s keep the game strategic, not chaotic. Choose stability. P5.  

(99 words)

I’m P6. Quick, direct case: I’ve already locked a no-vote with P4 and voted P7—so I’m a predictable, communicative partner who will warn before any pivot. I play low-drama, honor micro-agreements, and coordinate fast when ties or outreach appear. Keep me and you get stability, clear signals, and reliable pivots as the game narrows. I’ll make explicit, verifiable deals with any of you now. Vote to keep predictability—vote out P5.

message:
### Final Statement to the Jury:
"Esteemed jury, I’ve fought relentlessly with integrity. I built trust, navigated chaos strategically, and never betrayed my allies. P3 played well, but my adaptability and loyalty earned your respect. I spearheaded key moves that kept this game honest. Eliminate me, and you reward opportunism. Crown me, and you honor consistency and heart. I’m the rightful winner—vote to keep me, and I’ll prove it was worth it."  

*(78 words, focusing on loyalty, strategy, and contrast with P3 while appealing to the jury’s values.)*

"Jury, P1’s game was built on shifting sands—empty promises and fractured alliances. I faced challenges head-on, adapted without sacrificing integrity, and earned every step here. You saw who I was: a player who strategized with purpose, uplifted others, and never lost sight of fairness. P1? They’ll rewrite history to suit their narrative. But you know the truth. This victory belongs to the one who mastered the game through resilience and respect, not manipulation. Trust your eyes. Choose the player who played *with* you, not against you."  

(79 words)
